text: This looked o.k. (deep amber) and smelled good, but the same dimensions that others praised caused me to rebel. Heavy, resinous hops end with a long, intense bitterness. Not my thing. My solution was to use most of the bottle for cooking (a chicken marinade that called for beer). Bottle.
Bottle a brown colored beer with a white head aroma malts citrus fruits spicy and bitter hops flavor malts citrus fruits spicy pineapple and bitter hops

Cerveza negra, amarga, se siente el sabor a café, al final sabe cómo a miel,

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at home. A mind blowing smell and a solid bitter after taste make this one an enjoyable and relatively easy drinking ale.
Clear dark ruby, tanned lacing foam head. Hoppy aroma and quite bitter in taste. Do no quite classify this as an amber ale, more dark IPA. Still OK though. (Velp 201704)

Bottled. 15cl sample. Old note. The aroma has caramel, pine, citrus, quite some fruit. Dark coloured beer with a medium sized off-white head. The taste is moderate bitter with caramel sweetness and piney hops, citrus, fruit. Medium bodied beer.

From a 355ml bottle on 4/2/2017. Pours a murk amber with the barest of heads. The nose features some caramel and fruit notes. Taste wise, this is big and assertive, coming across as bigger than 7%. Theres lots of sweet caramel and brown sugar, with a hint of fruit as well, but its defined by huge, assertive, lingering, resiny hops (Hop Flood is indeed an appropriate moniker). Full bodied with average carbonation. Damn this is good stuff. Big, complex, challenging and extremely satisfying. Probably better classified as an American Strong Ale. Another top flighter from Evil Twin.
Bottle- pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is malty, flowery with a bit of sugar. Taste is malty with an astringent hop hit which slowly fades to a roast burnt sugar and hop finish.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
From bottle in Belgian ale glass. Pours an opaque mahogany with a frothy tan head. An earthy malty aroma leading into rich taste broad in both malt and hop profile. A nice lingering bitter finish.
Lovely stuff this. Loads of sweet caramel, toffee, biscuity malts... Bit of pine and resin, low bitterness. Dry finish. Lovely.

12fl oz bottle @Boulevard, Irún. 04-08-2015.
BBD: 030/15?.
In short: malty, fruity ale.
Pours dark amber with nice off white head. Short head retention, some lacing. Short head retention, some lacing. Roasty, malty, caramel, licorice nose. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is quite bitter, some fruity, caramel. Dry and bitter aftertaste.

El aroma es complejo, afrutado y con una importante carga de pino.

En boca entra muy dulce al principio, con la malta tostadita muy presente. Pero poco a poco se va tornando amarga, hasta que una riada de lúpulo te sorprende y es entonces cuando comprendes el por qué de su nombre. El final, amargo y seco, es muy duradero. Una grandísima cerveza.

Bottle - hazy amber color, nice creamy head. Taste is barrique-like: Old red wood, slightly sour, red berries. Quite sweet, toffee. Finish is medium bitter. Its a decent beer but not my style. Wouldnt have it again.

Pour is a dark brown with a large white head. Aroma is a sweet malt with a faint whiff of hops. I can tell this is going to be malt heavy. Flavor is a dark malt with some dark fruit like a sunmaid raison. There is no date on the bottle so I dont know how old this is. There is not much hop presence but the malt used has a decent flavor.

Uma experiência interessantíssima essa Hop Flood: é uma cerveja complexa, que muda bastante ao longo do tempo. A recomendação é beber devagar e sentir essas mudanças (no meu caso, especialmente, ela estava um pouco gelada no começo, o que ressaltou ainda mais essas diferenças)

Cerveja marrom escura. creme bege de média duração. O aroma inicial é intenso, de lúpulo fresco, cítrico, com poucas notas do malte, que vão ficando cada vez mais marcantes, com resíduos de caramelado e açúcar mascavo. O sabor é amargo, com forte presença do lúpulo, doce do malte, frutas escuras. O amadurecimento revela uma presença de madeira e deixa o frutado cada vez mais em segundo plano, sobrando só o amargor e adstringência. É uma cerveja de corpo médio pra alto, com sabor marcante e persistente. Complexa, possui baixa drinkabilidade, mas é uma cerveja extrema.

Bottle. The beer has got a deep dark brown colour with a steady head and medium to smooth body. Aroma of hops and rum. Taste of hops, barrel, oak, rum raisins, dried plums, prunes, woods and barley. Smooth finish with rum hints. Highly delicious.

the aroma is caramel and fruity with hints of pine, toffee, resin and spicy herbs... the taste is caramel and spicy with notes of toffee, bisquit, pine needles, dried plum and nuts... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...

Bottle at home. Aroma is rich caramel malt, biscuit, hops, pine resin, toffee, ripe fruits, bit toasted. Flavour is moderate to medium sweet and nicely bitter. Long bittersweet finish. Body is above medium. Nicely bittersweet Barley Wine-ish hoppy Amber Ale, good stuff.
Bottle into glass. Pours hazy amber with medium tan head. Aroma is strongly of hops with a long, strongly bitter finish. Probably the most bitter beer Ive enjoyed to date.

Sweet malt some wood scent and smells of dark fruits. Dark reddish brown color with small off white head bit of lacing. Taste of sweet malts dark dank fruit with super bitter finish. Medium body with light carbonation. Very sticky for elder ale but love the complexity and its something different. Nice work.

Bottle shared at a tasting at troubless place. Hazy brownish-copper with beige head. Sweetish aroma with notes of dried fruits, caramel and date honey. Bitter flavor with notes of caramel, very hoppy, dried fruits, sweetish, a bit stale. Medium-bodied.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 Bottle shared at a tasting. Hazy amber with a big head. Aroma of caramel and fruity hops. Flavor is malty, notes of caramel, some fruitiness, honey, biscuit, bitter finish. Medium-bodied, oily. Probably better when fresh.

Pours dark brown. Aroma hits you in the face with dank hops. Very sweet bouquet. Flavour is full but very full on. Not perfectly balanced. Quite bitter but very enjoyable.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubless place. Thanks zvsn & rayaron. Hazy amber. Aroma of malt, caramel, and stale hops. Sweetish malty flavor, with caramel, a bit of toast, and bitter hops, piney, slightly stale. Medium-bodied.

Bottle 33cl.
@ Zombier, Malaga, Spain.
A: Hazy brown.
T: Malt, caramel, hops, raisins.
Muddy brown color. Sticky White head. Absolutely delicious. An amber ale filled with hops. Best beer Ive had this last 2 months in China.

June 20th, 2014 - The writers back at Eviltwins Brewery are doing top notch work on these labels, setting an environment and attitude for the beer before the head is even pierced by a top lip. And once out, the aroma tumbles forward with all the classic double IPA scents, heavy and sweet, but leaning more towards pine and oak. It is even more robust than many double IPAs in my review archive, and I like it, strong but poised. The flavor is a little less balanced, with a much more bitter approach. The bitterness takes over after a quick puff of sweetness on the front, and stays there, slightly stronger with each sip. I would have preferred a slightly tweaked balance, but for $3.55 I am pleased.
Hops with this beer give only bitterness. I couldnt find any variety hoppy flavors(I know its an amber ale!) Its too bitter for me though.
pour dark amber with a light offwhite head. caramel, and dark fruit aromas. taste light bitter with sweet notes. light to medium bodied. average carbonation. light bitter finish
Bottled 33cl. Nice copper amber ale, nice white head. Nose is nice, mainly honey / toffee. Texture is dry, bitterness is strong and very astringent, a bit disturbing.

God damn you, Evil Twin. When you said Hop Flood, I didnt realise you were going to be so fucking literal about it. I left a third of the bottle on the kitchen bench. And its good beer! So thats a third of a good thing I missed out on, which at Australian prices is enough to buy a house (not in Australia, obviously - somewhere else). Anyway: the beer. Looks good (the stuff in the glass, not the stuff on the bench - that looked sad). Murky brown, great length on the head. Lots of brown sugars in the nose, plus some Pacific hops. Lovely thick palate. Chewy toffee notes, raisins, some alcohol burn and lip-smacking hoppiness. This might be about the best example (albeit hugely atypical) of a beer style that usually leaves me cold. Heres to Double Ambers, hold the sugar. (330ml bottle from Leura Cellars, May 2016)
Bottle. Amber with copper color, yellowish foam. Good aroma: rich malt, honey nectar, floral, dried fruit, raisins. Taste: honeyed nectar, pleasant bitter hops, fruit and raisins, very good.

On a beautiful summer night in July while peaceful Danes rocked at Roskilde Festival and sipped wine in their picturesque summer retreats, an apocalyptic tidal surge flooded the famous Ølbutikken in Copenhagen and drowned thousands of precious beer  Hop Flood is a bitter tribute to the heroic bottles that didnt make it.
Brown colour, off white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee and strawberries. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation.

From bottle. Murky amber color with a small yellowish head and lots of sediment. Aroma and taste of hops, caramel, toffee, and more hops. Taste is complex with a good amount of sweetness that is overbalanced by the bitter qualities of the hops. Medium full body.

Bottle from Perfect Pour. Nice dark amber body with little head. Nose is barley, roasty, sweet. Taste is nice and malty and spicy and toasty and milky up front, warms up a bit and nice maltier, almost chocolate finish. Really good stuff. A flood of hops!
Bottle. Hazy amber color with a thick foamy off-white head. Aroma of resin, grapefruit and pine. Bitter taste with some sweetness. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

7%ABV. Amber Ale.

Poured out brown Amber. 18ºSRM.

Noses is sweet and fruity.

Mouthfeel is soapy. There is good carbonation. Palate has sweet roasted malt, nuts, burnt caramel. Hops are vegetal, bitter, flowery, spicy with hyssop-like minty bitter, there is taragon-like flavor and aroma on the palate.

Finish is medium and bitter.

Good beer.
Bottle at Schouskjelleren, january 24st 2015. Amber body with a small beige head. Aroma of old hops and cardboard. Taste is grassy, toffee, with a harsh bitter finish.

Bottle 33 cl from Amstein - St-Légier (CH). Reddish brown amber with an average beige head. Appetizing aromas of caramel, citrusy hop, earthy with herbs and pepper. The taste is dry, spicy, peppery with roasted, herbs and burnt toffy. The hop stands out in a dry finale with accents of blood orange, earth and plants. Disappointent, masculine and rough beer without feminine side.

Mild earthy spice and pine aroma. Hazy cinnamon brown body with a some sediment floating around. Topped with an off-white head that likes to linger. Bold bitter start but has a light clean finish. Has light toasted malt quality. Decent balanced brew.
Long and hoppy after taste. Lovely colour. After taste better than initial taste. Very good aroma

Dont know what to think of this.

Nice hoppy amber ale, floral, citrus, herbs, earthy, grass, spruce,

33cl bottle at Blackfriars Glasgow
 pours A dark copperish colour with a white head
 Aroma is dry grain bit of hop
 Taste is really weird,very chemical tones bit rough
 not very nice strange beer
Наиболе& среднее пиво для близнец& Однако сам факт того, что исключи& с первого глотка можно угадать пивовар& говорит о многом.

Aroma is malt, candy, hops, tropical fruit and pine. Appearance is reddish brown, light brown head. Taste is very malty, much like a barleywine, but finishes with a crazy ass bitterness like over-steeped black tea. Mouthfeel is medium body and crisp carbonation, a very bitter aftertaste. Overall, this is a beer that doesnt know what to call itself. Decent, but weird.

355ml bottle from Cornelius. Pours murky amber-brown with a thin clotted cream head. Massive resinous hop aromas, plus caramel. Taste is very bitter, as you might expect, some almost tea-like tannins. More resin. Oily mouthfeel, but the massive bitterness cuts through it. Long bitter linger.

When I cracked this sucker open, I thought I was heading for an IPA. It calls itself an Amber yet despite the darker than average colour and provocative malt presence, this here is an IPA-ish creature that I am glad exists. Lots of brown bread, toffee and cracker malt snap unionize with punchy citrus and floral hops. Brazenly bitter to boot, Hop Flood smacks of audacious flavours and wrestles a bad mood with its 7% ABV. Head for days on this pup, lacing all the way.

Poured a clouded dark brown with a one-finger light tan frothy head that retained well and laced OK. Carbonation medium and fine. Aroma of slightly sweet caramel, faint molasses, slightly roasted malts and no obvious alcohol. Taste initially sweet then passes quickly to a moderate to strong persistent bitterness; alcohol well hidden. Medium body. Creamy mouthfeel. Smooth and clean with a lingering moderate bitterness.

(bottle) very bright reddish amber colour with a medium tall, fine brownish head; creamy palate; aroma starts with a a whiff of citrus, then honey, stewed fruit, jam; mostly dry flavour with a long, medium bitter finish

Bottle at Brooklyn Diner. Sharp hop bite, plenty of citrus, grapefruit, nectarine, lime, minty notes, solid caramel malt base, dry hoppy finish. A very flavorful hoppy amber, maybe a tad boozy but nice treat for hopheads.
Bottle at home. Lightly caramel with earthy hop flavours. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Not bad.

Lovely amber with enough grapefruity hoppy kick, lovely malt background, caramel. Moderate to light sweetness with moderate bitterness, quite dry finish.
Solid all the way
Ananasa hopsis ar iesala noti, saldes aromatā, bet garā nedaudz savelk lūpiņas. :DD Patīkams

Well - buyer beware. I just noticed that this was bottled almost a year and a half ago. I gotta look at the bottles closer. The silver lining here is that the beer is still pretty good. My eyes are drying out. Bitter bitter bite, caramel, pine, spicy peaches, this is really fucking bitter. Its got heat and tastes like a rye ipa. Time to play Galaga.
Love this hopped up Amber. Drinks like an IPA but loaded with notes of caramel and toast

330ml bottle served in a pint glass. 
A: Pours a deep and slightly cloudy amber color forming a small but solid and cream tan head with excellent retention forming lots of thin and lingering lacings in the glass. 
S: Flowery and malty. Sweet caramel. Strong notes of resin and pine. Grapefruit and zest. 
T: Slightly sweet upfront that becomes quickly quite bitter. Strong bittersweet balance. Persistent bitterness. Strong notes of caramel malts and grapefruit. Great hops profile, a mix of pine, resin, orange zest, grass and hop cone flowers. 
M: Medium to heavy body. Average carbonation. Strong malty bittersweet aftertaste. Strong notes of pine and toffee. Persistent bitterness. 
O: Great drinkability. Excellent Amber Ale. Strong hops character.

12 ounce bottle from Uptown Market. Pours a somewhat cloudy reddish hue, a big layer of sediment on the bottom. A big caramel and toffee nose. The flavor is soft citrus, big caramel, low bitterness though a very hoppy amber. Some toast. Quite easygoing. Solid. Four years ago this would have really stood out a ton.

From bottle at some village in Puebla, Mex. Very kinda heavy hop flavor, not really an Amber Ale as tagged. Aromas of Peach, Passion fruit, some Mango and of course a carnival of hops dancing all around your glass and tongue..., Surprisely not a sweet beer like others from Evil Twin...!!!!
33 cl. bottle. Dark amber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, peach, spice, malt, caramel and straw.

Bottle from Sake no Taniguchi. Now this is an Amber Ale~! 

Evil Twin Hop Flood 7%

Pouring an intriguing reddish brown that sucks in the light in such a way as to hint at black with a thick beige head of foam. Its got a big resinous hop bouquet, malty caramel and some boozy heat.

The taste is bitter pine bark, a bit herbal and huge underlying caramel syrupy sweetness. I could honestly see many people mixing this up with a double IPA. Nice stuff.
Bottle from beergium. I think the cap had a problem. Dark copper color. No head. Medium sweetness, low bitterness. Aroma is malty, hoppy, spicy. Must retaste.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2015 Murky, dark amber color with beige head. Caramel and some earthy hops, sweet at first but gets pretty bitter in the finish and lingers in the aftertaste. Not bad but nothing really special.

Bottle in Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Deep amber with a nice big frothy cream head. Fruity aroma with peachy notes. The flavour is spicy with rye, toffee, stewed fruit and pine hop. Bitter finish. Tasty.

Hazy dark amber, with beige froth. Strong hop and caramel aroma. Flavour has solid bitterness along with floral hops and caramel, even hints of licorice. Long and very bitter finish. Dry and medium bodied. Good one.

Green hops, floral with pine and cookie dough sweet malt. Hazy caramel colored with tan head. Sweeter malt up front with toffee flavors quickly give way to bitter hops that seem to get even more bitter the longer it stays in your mouth. An Amber Ale that has ODed on IBUs! Has a minerally aftertaste, almost like putting a penny in your mouth.

Smell of hops, mango, grass. Deep bronze colour, high beige head. Aroma of hops, spruce. Very bitter. Dry palate, flat carbon. Doesnt taste like an amber ale, doesnt look like an amber ale. But good nonetheless.

Bottle from The Beerhive. Ruby body with a thin off-white head. Good lacing. Aroma of candy, pine, burnt sugar and stewed tea. Flavour is both rich and bitter - notes of wood, candy, caramel and juicy hops. Medium body with an oily texture. Soft fizz. A really good beer, delicious flavour. Would love to try on cask.
355ml bottle @ Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Pours deep brown with moderate tanned head. Aroma is hoppy resin and malt. Taste is true to the cause. Amber malts, hoptastic and a bit sticky in a good way.

Bottle, 0.33l. Pours clear brown with medium creamy tan-like head, soft visible carbonation and many floating yeast particles. Aroma of mango, papaya, passion fruit, berries, caramel, pine with mild medicinal note. Taste starts with moderate sweet caramel and toasted malt, follows by dried fruits acidity with grassy notes, warming mouthfeel and heavy bitter finish. Full body, creamy texture and lively carbonation in palate. Bold, bitter and brutal...

Bottle lurking in the back of the fridge. Copper color with decent head but lots of floaters. Smells of caramel and indistinct bitterness. Initial flavor is kind of off sweet, which is not so good. The underlying bitterness is nice.

Bottle from Beer Gonzo, Coventry. Dark brown in appearance. Strong sweet caramel aromas, citrus. Taste is herbal, pine, slightly grapefruit, caramel. Slightly burnt finish but a nice bitterness throughout. Good stuff

Lukt: Rosin, krydder, citrus or en anelse kamfer.
Utseende: Brun.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum.
Smak: Rosin, karamell og citrus.

330ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Dark amber copper color with off white to light beige head. Hoppy aroma, pine, grassy, light fruity, malty, caramel, light bread, light licorice. Sweet and heavy bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Aroma is roasty malts, earthy hops, clove, lemongrass and citrus. Taste is roasty caramalized malts transitioning into an earthy , lemongrass and clove rich hopiness. Appearance is a cloudy amber with chunky sediment. Head retains very well.
Pours unclear light brown with medium tanned head. Lots of sediments and very hoppy. Not my favourite.
Bottle to glass. Deep amber color with a light tan head. Old resiny hops in the aroma. Thick amber, caramel malts in the flavor. Tastes bigger than the 7%. Not bad.
Espuma pouca, cor âmbar escura. Aroma de ervas e lúpulo. Gosto segue aroma mas com ervas e lúpulo bem pronunciados é um pouco de caramelo no meio. Amargor perfeito!

12fl oz bottle at home from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Body is hazy rusty amber, tons of small yeast particles, head is small, beige, average lasting, good lacing. Nose is fruity, chemical, caramel. Flavor is hops, caramel, dried fruits, vegetables, roasted peanuts, grapefruit, orange peel, spices, light herbs, light chocolate. Light sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting medium roasty heavy hoppy bitter. Full body, dry texture, soft carbonation. Quite easy, very tasty, great beer.
Bottle, 330 ml from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Pours dark orange, beige head. Caramel malty and sweet. Piney hoppy with medium bitter finish.

Bottle from Brewdog online. Dark amber with beige coloured head. aroma is hoppy , sweet malts, caramel. Very bitter, harshly bitter I would say, but the malts make themselves known just about. medium body, with quite high carbonation, lingering big bitter finish. Good but also a bit harsh and unbalanced for me.

Old rating rerated 25.07.2015, 0,35l bottle @ UNA:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly concentrated sweet foresty, leafs, caramel malts, pine needles, hops, moss, wet grass, sap, bark. Taste is slightly harsh concentrated grassy, old leafs, soil, minerals, wet grass, weeds, bark, old harsh hops, paper. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly harsh soapy mouthfeel. Fair enough, not as good as I remember it...

12 oz bottle. Bottled on 12/4/14. From saveurbiere.com.
Deep amber color with a big foamy dirty beige head. 
Dark resiny hoppy aroma with mild caramel sweetness and malty dryness. 
The flavor is strong dark resiny hops and some sweet caramel malt. Harsh and too amber ale for me.

UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 Bottle in Beooklyn-- Pours deep dark copper with thin compact white head. Nose is burnt caramel. Aromas are toasted malts, caramel, raisin, resin. Average carbonation, oily texture. Long harsh bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home. Beautiful deep, dark amber colour with a beige foamy head. Piny hop profile, like sniffing a pine forrest actually, nicely roasted malts with caramel and light coffee, herbal and spicy too. Dry, piny finish. Great balance. Body is (too) light, medium carbonation.

Extrêmement amer, ambré profond presque ruby, corps très malté.

Une bière EXTREME.

Color cobre y espuma beige poco persistente. Aroma a lupulo y caramelo. Sabor dulce y maltoso y pronto pasa a notas resinosas, recordando a las barleywine, buena integracion de alcohol y carbonatacion media baja.
Bottle. Poured a deep amber color with an off white head. Stale dry hops, citrus, floral, grassy, and a bit toasty.

Bottle to tulip
Aroma of hops, caramel, pine, resin, and tropical fruit. Hazy deep red amber with some particulates and a frothy, long lasting 1 cm light tan head. Taste is primarily bitter with some middling fruity sweetness and a touch of bread and malt.
Beats full thick Coffey cream coloured foam. Dark Amber colour. Grape, citrus, apricot, malt , caramel and a profound bitterness.
Bière ambrée de couleur marron cuivre foncé, belle mousse, arôme poivre et végétaux, amertume sèche. 33 Cl Bièrocratie.

Rating 1114 - June 2, 2014 Bottle 330mL. Clear amber-reddish pour with a bubbly white head, sticky lacing. Aroma is a bucket load of floral, citrusy hops. Taste is mild caramel malty sweetness, with a powerful punch of hop textures. Medium carbonation, mild alcohol warmth, medium bodied.
Dark copper in color with a huge foamy tan head. Malty, nutty, and a bit sweet with an earthy feel. Fairly dry, hoppy, and a bit bitter in the finish. Nicely balanced.
Bottle at home. Hazy amber beer with an offwhite head. Hoppy fruity, citrus aroma. Hoppy, grassy and caramell flavour. A nice refreshing beer :-)
UPDATED: JUN 22, 2015 How : bottle Appearance : dark red with a small off-white head. Aroma: spice, grass, herbs, nuts and fruits. Palate: medium to light body, average carbonation.
Bottled. Poured orange brown. Very aromatic floral hop forward beer that moderates as it sits. OK.

12 OZ bottle.
Appearance: Murky amber pour with a small off white head.
Aroma: Piney hops, resin and caramel
Taste: MOderate sweet caramel with quite some piney bitterness, also resin and som citrus. The finish however contains also some cofee and roasted tones which add further bitterness to the allready piney bittereness.
Medium body, average carbonation.

Decent Amber ale but for me to unbalanced and focussed on bitterness.

Bottle 12 fl.oz. Slightly hazy deep auburn color, small but mostly lasting frothy beige head, good lacing; strong sweet malty and complex aroma, caramel, palm sugar, maple leaf syrup, dried dark fruits, biscuit, hints of licorice; taste medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter, roasted malts; medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, aftertaste sweetbitter, roasted malt, chocolate, spicy and earthy notes; a complex and heavy hopped but well-balanced strong amber ale, excellent.
355ml bottle from Craftissimo, Hong Kong. Pours dark amber/brown with an off white head. Aroma of malt and pine. Harsh edge to the bitter finish.

Aromat: tosty, karmel, melanoidyny, lekkie utlenienie. Są także nuty chmielowe w postaci owoców tropikalnych i niewielki alkohol.

Barwa: mocno bursztynowa, raczej czerwona, w stronę miedzi. początkowo względnie klarowna, choć z niewielkimi drobinkami. Piana ecru, drobno pęcherzykowa, umiarkowanej wielkości i względnie trwała. Ładnie oblepia szkło.

Smak: wyraźne nuty słodowe - karmel, tosty, melanoidyny, jednak z niewielką słodyczą. Jest natomiast lekko kwaskowy posmak, chmielowa kontra i alkoholowa nuta. Goryczka w okolicach średniej, drażniąca, ale niezbyt długa. Pełnia średnia plus, umiarkowane do wysokiego wysycenie, odrobinę szczypiące w język, trochę śliskie odczucie na języku i alkoholowo-goryczkowy finisz.
Bottle from City Beer, San Francisco. Aroma of dark fruit, sharp citrus fruit, and pine. Caramel, dark fruit, bitter hoppy taste with a cooked apple finish.

Faut pas déconner ... Il sagit bien dune IPA ou alors mon palais a bien pâli !
Assez asséchante et pointue en attaque ... Finalement agréable mais pas dun abord aisé. Une petite pointe de rondeur ( Ha ha !! ) ne serait pas de refus ! Une certaine complexité que jai du mal à décrire ... Un côté résineux aussi.
Looks like kotikalja. But taste, wow, what a punch. Sweet, bitter and spicy. Pretty tough. Hops indeed.

Bottle from Mitsuyas. Poured into a shaker pint. Pours a bronze amber with a light tan head that dissipates almost instantly. Intense resin and pine aromas with hints of grapefruit, caramel, roasted toffee and biscuit. The biscuit aromas become more pronounced as it warms up. Medium to full body with a slightly oily mouthfeel. Bitter on the palate with a hint of roasted sweetness that peeks its head out as it warms up. This is boldly hopped amber through and through with a long bitter finish. A heavy amber.
A great beer to have with lunch, enough about it to taste good, but complements food very well

이블트윈 브루어리-홉플& 7% ABV 보통 몰래 가게에서 빼 마시는 맥주는 꿀맛이어어야 하는데 사람 고문하는 쓴맛으로 점철된 맥주. 하루종일 바로 옆에서 누가 엄청 시끄럽게 모터 소리내며 잔디깎는 맛과 향. 스트레스 쌓인다. 차라리 서던티어 브루는 복잡하게 튀어나오기라 했지. 한병이상은 못마실 맥주. 온리더 스트롱 엠버에일. 홉가지고 끝판 깨려는 경쟁 좀 그만 끝났으면 좋겠다.

Tap at hbf15. Hazy dark red color, white head. Aroma is nice hops, rye bread, fruity. Nice hoppy, rye bread.
Redish, cloudy with yellowish foam. Aroma of burned suker, raisins and malt. Malt, raisins, caramel, with sweet burned caramel bitterness that grows in the aftertaste. A bit watery.

Cerveja marrom, espuma bege de média duração. Aroma amadeirado, adocicado (caramelo), licorosa, alcoólica. Paladar de amargor médio, reforçando o caráter amadeirado. No aftertaste o amargor prevalece, deixando a boca com sensação de seca. Cheguei a sentir traços de fumo queimado, amargor parecido após fumar um cigarro, mas beeem discreto.

Dirty ugly brown with foam pieces on top. Smells like a nice round caramelly amber ale. Decent sweet notes are overruled by an aggressive roasty chocolate-coffee finish, that is a bit overdone. The resulting aftertaste is a bit too dry and tastes as if you brushed your teeth with hard coal. Not bad though, but not my kind of beer.

Brownish-amber color with big white head. Nice lacing. Aroma of caramel malt, toast, citrus hops. Taste is bitter, caramel, nice toasty body, bitter finish stays. Even some coffee in the end. Smooth mouthfeel. That?s how I like a hoppy Amber Ale! Exactly my kind of beer!

A good amber with heavy hops. Pours a bright ruby amber with a thin beige head. Tons of lacing. The aroma is biscuity and caramelized with heavy malts and juicy citrus hops. Great balance with heavy bitterness, lingering astringency and smooth, rich and heavy toasted malts.

Bottle from Chester Beer & Wine. Murky amber pour with a small off white head. Piney hop and sweet malts aplenty in the beak. Sweetish flavour, with plenty of hops in tandem with caramel, citrus and peach notes. Robust bitter linger in the finish. The name perhaps suggested a DIPA but this is a very competent amber. Worth a punt.
Draft. Pours a hazy dark amber color. Aroma and taste are toffee with a bitter finish.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl à la brasserie, couleur ambrée, belle pousse blanche et effervescence moyenne, nez assez agrume et sur le grain, enbouche grosse attaque sur le malt caramélisé et grillé puis énorme attaque sur le houblon floral et sur les agrumes. Fin de bouche sur une ponte danis.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Nez houblonné à souhait. Palais ultra houblonné (trop ?), amertume délicate mais qui s'intensifie sur la fin. Arômes de fruits rouges. Cool.
23.8.2014. Intense pine and red berries in aroma. Taste is barley wine like malty and slightly sweet, pine, way too sharp bitter. Too much "unattached" hops.

Hazy dark amber with a thin sticky off beige head. Unfortunately theres these weird floaty bits that an "amber" isnt supposed to have--that weirdly stay in place, suspended in space. Lovely intricate amber malt nose with caramel sweetness, a little nuttiness, and a somewhat big fresh hop note that isnt too bitter. The flavor starts out much more bitter than the aroma, with some deep earthy leafy hops and big bitter tones, followed by a bittersweet earthy caramel and amber malts, finishing a little bitter and resiny. Meh.
Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. Hazy dark brown coloured with malty and bitter spicy grapefruit flavours followed by a creamy zesty blackcurrant and coffee finish. Excellent!

Bottle. Pours a cloudy dark brown with lots of floaties and a large livht tan head on there. Nose has stale hops and is clearly past its prime. Taste is also stale, with just some hints of toast coming through. Fuck Total Wine and their inability to store beer properly.

12oz bottle. Pours a deep garnet red. Head is white, smooth, and lacy. Aroma is rich malts, well blended with nice hop character. Nice flavor that seamlessly blends the two contrasting components of malt and hops. A nice classy beer.
on tap at baren i kronborggade 3. dark amber with a beige head; juicy aroma of grapefruit, nimm zwei, hints of red berries; full-bodied with loads of citrus zest and a rasping bitterness. delicious

Bottled. Amber colour, small slightly off-white head. Aroma is floral, some toffee, mild bread as well as some fruity and grassy notes. Flavour is fruity, floral, some crisp bready and toffeeish malts along with some herbal and mildly earthy notes. Balanced.

12 fl oz bottled on 02/18/14. Unclear medium copper, lasting solid fine tan foam. Aroma of citrus fruity hop and c-malt. Lightly bitter citrusy floral herbal earthy hop taste, hint of pine, slightly sweet caramel malt, dry grapefruity finish. Could be classified an IPA. Nice. NFL (Not For Lagerboys)
Tap at Fatheads, Portland. Colour is cloudy light brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, some floral, crospiness, hops and malts.

Bottle. Pours with nice light brown head retention. Dark amber with suspension. Sweet and a bit sour with tons of hops (of course).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle. Unfiltered bronze amber. Pretty boldly hopped amber, very nice. Rich fruity amber malt, some crystal malt stickiness. Deep, piny, resinous hops. Some cool, crisp feels as well. Quite a good beer. Right on.

0,33l fles thuis. Uitgeschonken mooi bruin met een fijne creme kraag. Geur is fruitig granaatappel, perzik en iets kruisig. Smaak is mooi bitterzoet met een bovengemiddeld volle acdronk met mooi opbouwend laurier. Erg aangenaam bier
Looks like an amber beer but nicely hoppy like a solid IPA. Melons grapefruit. On tap at barley brothers winnipeg

bottle to glass. grapefruit/citrus nose. strong grapefruit in the mouth as well. Like the body a lot. Long bitter finish. Red IPA qualities. [three hours later] guess I forgot to finish rating this beer. good, but not memorable

UPDATED: JUN 4, 2015 Translucent ruby red/brown. Beige-white head with big foamy bubbles. Frothy lacing. Smells very musty, sawdust, wood chips, hay, woodsy hop, spicy peppery malt, bit herbal/minty. Tastes of woody resinous hop, potpourri, spice. Body is bitter, fizzy, very smooth, foamy dry finish. Aroma is flavourful but quite musty (age?); but overall a pretty good beer.

On bottle at Schouskjelleren . Amber color, good foam. Immediatly hoppy, some fruitiness & citrus. Medium body & complexity . Good bitterness & balance
Very Enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Amber ale? Parecia uma IPA. Amargor bem pronunciado, encorpada e muito gostosa. É a amber ale mais amarga que já provei.

Appearance: Clear deep amber color with a fine thick off white head. Ok lacing.Aroma: Bready, fruity and pleasant hoppy.Palate: Medium to full body. A bit sweet and a fine bitterness. Average to soft carbonation.Taste: Malty, bready, dried fruit, mild citric and a bit herbal.Overall impression: Nice tasty evening sipper.Personal stats: Bottle at Schouskjelleren in Oslo, Norway
330ml bottle. Poured dark reddish brown with an off white head. Initially sweet, but becomes a lot more bitter (possibly too bitter?) the longer it lingers on the palate

Bottle into IPA glass. Pours a hazy amber colour with a lot if sediment. Aroma is jammy hops with a touch of alcohol. Taste is astringent bitterness with a touch of fruit. Hoping this is a bad bottle. Will re-rate when I get another bottle.

-- rated via 'Find A Beer' for Blackberry 10

average creamy offwhite head. good lacing. mostly diminishing. murky medium-particled thick light brown body. aroma: moderate malty, caramel, heavy hoppy, grass. if: light sweet bitter. ff: heavy bitter; long duration. palate: medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, metallic finish. Caráter maltado inicial pertencente ao estilo engolido pelo amargor lupulado no final do gole, desfigurando as diretrizes de uma boa amber ale. Praticamente uma IPA, diferenciando-se desta por perceber-se uma backbone maltada fortemente subjugada pelo lúpulo. 25 s
Drank from a bottle. Quite a nice beer but the hops are a bit rough. Could have used a bit more of other flavours.

Bouteille de 12 oz dégustée chez La Succursale (Montréal, QC) au coût de 8,00$. Arôme: Odeur de céréales avec une pointe dhoublons résineux. Apparence: La couleur est ambrée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dhoublons résineux avec une pointe de caramel. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût houblonné. (Rating #6068)

Bought from Miorge-Mihoublon, Arlon, Belgium. 12 FL. OZ. Bottle.
Pours a magnificent red bronze colour. Though it is mostly clear, I can distinguish some deposit. It doesnt hinder the colour.

The aroma is all that I expect from Evil Twin : a maelstroem of hops with a mixture in this case of woody/fruity/caramely aromas ! The taste is quite something (as always with Evil Twin beers).Bitterness is felt straight away but followed by hoppy/leafy notes. The finish is quite dry.

Here again, we can find the master carftsmanship of american brewers. Whoever say that americans cant brew do not know what they are talking about.

Leicht trübes kupferbraunes Bier mit einer feinen aber geringen beigen Schaukrone. Geruch nach reifen Früchte, hopfig, kräftig malzig. Geschmack sehr hopfig fruchtig, bitter, kräftig malzig, reife Aprikosen, Melonen.

Pours dark amber and very hazy ... you guys never heard of a protein rest? Aroma is sweet malt and modest hop. Taste is very sweet, hopping is there but not in your face. Bitterness balances the strong sweetness. Bitterness on aftertaste is a bit harsh. Candy, citrus, malt when it warms up. Quite a tasty beer.
ours copper with an off white head. Sweet toffee malts, plenty of flowery bitterness, and lighter toasted bready notes.

Rich amber and bronzed coloured body with a thick, four centimetre tall just tan head. Aroma of caramel, earthy malt, nuts and a bunch of resinous, piney hops that dominate the aroma. Medium-bodied; Assertive grassy and herbal note with a lot of hop bitterness shows up front with a pungent and slightly biscuity malt flavour showing some yeast too. Aftertaste is a bit robust with some nuts, earth, pine and a bunch of hop flavours - not too much sweetness, just bitterness. Overall, a nice beer and good for the style, but nothing truly revolutionary here - just an overly hopped amber. I sampled this 33 cL bottle purchased from New Beer Distributors in New York, New York on 08-November-2014 for US$3,25 sampled at home in Washington on 06-January-2015.
Bottle from Dranken Geers. Dark ruby red/brown colour, creamy beige foam. Aroma of peach, pine and tropical fruit. Light sweet, very bitter finish. Very hoppy. Refreshing and drinkable. Very good!

355 ml bottle. Hazy dark reddish brown colour, thin white head. Sweetish caramel-malty aroma with fruity and resiny notes. The flavour is caramel-malty, with berry/fruity notes, and a dryish, lingering grapefruit-hoppy finish. Tasty.

12 fl. oz. Bottle. 
Pours clear amber with tan head. 
Aroma hop, citrus, pine, orange, caramel, sweet, brown sugar. 
Taste piney bitter, caramel sweets. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
Great beer.

330ml bottle, pours deep ruby amber with an off white head. Lots of yeasty flecks in the glass like a snowstorm. Aroma is rich roasted caramel, big piney notes, its got a coppery metallic edge which is more pleasant than it sounds. Body is medium, texture is slightly oily but finishes dry with a long bitterness. Carbonation is average. Nice unusual beer

Last beer of 2014. A deep amber colored brew with two finger head and fine lacing. Nose is hops and some fruity tones. Tastes of pine needles, dusty hops, bready, grainy, hint of dried fruits, and some earthy bitters. Slighty sticky finish with lingering pine needles om the tongue.

THX for sharing!
APPEARANCE: clear very dark blond beer, nice stable off white head.
NOSE: lots of pine, very hoppy, caramel, rather sweet.
TASTE: lots of pine, hoppy, dry, sweet, nice in general.

355ml bottle (thanks mjs). Clear copper color. Small size, bubbly beige head, stays. Metallic, jam, apples, sweet notes in aroma. Malty, caramel, stemmy, hop pellets in taste. Nice nettly bitterness. Covers alcohol pretty well.
Tried this the other night in BrewDog Bar Glasgow. Tasty! I'd never tried anything from Evil Twin before.

355ml bottle (Alko Arkadia, Helsinki)
Sweet aroma, caramelly, tinned peaches, including the tin. Nice dark red, tight tan head. Body is pure dark toffee. Sweet and sticky, so much caramel. Voimakkaan humalainen tuoksu. Vaahto katoava. Maku voimakkaan humalainen, kukkainen, suhteellisen pehmyt.
Strong bitter taste. Hoppy aroma. Not much of an aftertaste. Really bitter but not much more. I think i would mind drinking the whole bottle.
IPA classique, fort goût de houblon. Ce goût de houblon sinstalle directement et le goût névolue pas.

Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen. Hazy copper/amber beer with a nice offwhite/beige head. Hoppy fruity aroma, citrus, peach, caramel, raisins, some biscuits. Hoppy caramel flavor, grassy, peach, hay, citrus, biscuits, some nuts. Nice well hopped version of this style.
Bottle, amber pour with white head, nose is hoppy. Taste is citrus plus hops, awesome brew

(Bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Dec 12 2014) Poured a slightly hazy fairly dark amber with a tan head of dense foam that dissipated slowly. Aroma has quite a bit of caramel malt, earthy, resinous pine, some citrus peel/pith, bit of grain too. Flavour also built around that quite sweet caramel body, and earthy, somewhat resinous pine hops. Citrus present but only lightly fruity, pith mostly, a little grapefruit flesh. Quite bitter from the middle on, pine persisting, some grain building, ending in a fairly dry and quite astringent finish. Medium, oily body with fairly high carb. I think this wasnt super fresh and so the fruit characters to complement the sweet caramel, grain and quite piney bittering hops had faded. It didnt really do it for me, but I think I was pretty palate fatigued by the time I had it too. Fresh bottle could be decent?

Bottle from Toft Vin, CPH - amber pour with off-white head. Sweet fruity and malty aroma and taste, citrus pithy hoppy notes, peachy, marmalade, pine needles, caramel malty backbone, some sweet toffee, twiggy hoppy bitter finish. Good stuff.

Pours hazy medium to deep amber with one finger of dense tan head diminishing gradually to a medium cap, moderate lacing. (4/5) Nose is pine resin, pithy citrus, caramel malt, earthy fruit. (8/10) Taste is moderate sweet, moderately strong bitter. (8/10) Medium to full body, soft carbonation, strong bitter finish. (4/5)

So in the past couple of days Ive seen Mikkel redefine pale lager, two students of his redefine pilsner, and now Jeppe is redefining amber ale. I might as well just throw out the damn dictionary. Basically, this is an amber that smells and tastes like a DIPA. I can live with that. (16/20)

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy dark brown pour with a thin off white head, caramel and pine nuts aroma, taste has sweet caramel, some fresh hop with pine, a hint of grapefruit, decent stuff but maybe a little too sweet.

12oz bottle from Supermarket Liquors 
Pours hazy brown with a medium sized beige head and lots of sticky lacing. Aroma of pine, caramel and earthy. Taste is malty, caramel, citrus and pine resin 
A nice hoppy Amber

Awesome, appearance was an amber colour of a murky sludge - like hops going for a swim, heavily hopped earthy aroma of grass and fruits, acidic at the back of the throat, such a bitter aftertaste, very enjoyable well balanced heavy ale
On tap at sanctuary. Dark pour. A complex beer. It started out a little tart, but smoothed out as it warms. Layers of hop flavor. Finishes bone dry and bitter/slightly burnt flavored

Pours dark amber with a little head. Nose is lots of peaches, some banana, hops, very fruity. Lovely aroma. Quite bitter taste, peaches but sweetness added to the mix. Lovely amber ale, very hoppy stuff.
On tap at Biercab. Copper colour with white head. Mild aroma, mostly floral hops and caramel. Bitter, caramel and floral hops taste. Medium body.

12 oz bottle from BOTW (Rochester), served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.: Deep copper with floaties and a full reddish-tan head.
 
Aroma: Strong peppery, dank, dark hops, nice rich caramel/toffee malt, so peppery and dank.
 
Palate: Medium+ body, fairly soft carbonation
 
Flav.: More of the same...very spicy and peppery, dank, caramel, toffee and burnt sugar, blood orange too; off-dry with big bitterness and a long, richly malty and peppery finish.

Serious stuff!

Strong, bit too sweet and bold aroma with peach, caramel and floral hops. Dark brown/orange with light natural white head. Strong taste with peach, mango, pine and caramel. The amount of hops changes the taste to somewhat sweet and also palate feels like soft sugary ball rolling in your mouth. Medium taste spectrum and looong aftertaste with pine and guess...hops. Full/medium palate with medium/low carbonation. Slightly watery on background. Overall, bit too sweet, other vice perfect!
Dark mahogany body, offwhite head. Cookie caramel malt, some herbal dark hoppiness. Flavour is intense, much hops and malts.

Pours a clear red brown beer with a medium, fine, beige head.
Smells piny, hoppy, some caramel, some grass, small chocolate hint.
Tastes really bitter.
Leaves a bitter palate, very full and non alcoholic beer.
Great beer but a little to piny for me.
12oz bottle from Hops and Grapes in Hickory. Amber pour, beige head. Aroma of herbal, spice, earthy, grassy. Tastes are along the same lines with caramel and pine.

Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Hazy, thick amber. Loads of yeasty lumps. Filmy, off white head. Huge, chewy, resinous, minty, fusty orange hop. Equally big, caramel, grainy, toffee malts. Ripe banana thing going on, not to any detriment. Bit of soy sauce. Taste is chewy sweet. Light dry. Big, resinous, piny bitter. This is tasty stuff. Palate is heavy, oily, and chewy. Finishes big, resinous, piny bitter, with a sickly sweet close, that matches well. Very reminiscent of Dirty Bastard, but with a pile of greasy hops on top. Really tasty. Sort of beer you need to be in the mood for, mind you. Lovely.

Bottle from Alko. Brown color, beige head. Bitter taste with grapefruit, floral hops, pine, mango and resin. Bitter finish with grapefruit, hops and pine. Very nice hoppy brew, although pretty far from amber ales in terms of color and taste.
Draft. Pours copper with an off white head. Sweet toffee malts, plenty of flowery bitterness, and lighter toasted bready notes. Not bad.

Pours red-brown with a thin white head - tons of yeast floating around in this one. Atypical red ale aroma with sweet smelling malts. True to name, this is a nice red ale flooded with bitter piney hops. The hops hit you immediately then the syrupy and malty sweetness kicks in for the mid. Finish is bitter, bitter, bitter. While the flavors to me are not specific, this red ale is awesome - especially for hop lovers.

Very good looking beer. A thick long lasting head. Deep aroma. I got caught off guard with the bitterness. Wow. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle
Nice looking copper body, slight haze, tight beige head.
Hop dominant aroma; leafy, unripe tropical fruits, pine & citrus, with a nutty, toffee malt backbone.
Sticky resiny texture, drying, perhaps a touch boozy, moderate carbonation.
Once again, hops take the upper hand here - sappy, woody, spicy, some tropical fruit comes through. A touch of nutty malt in the mix, somewhat overshadowed, big bitterness lingers.
Would be nice to see some more maltiness to this, otherwise quite good - lots of hops!

12oz bottle, dark amber color, with a thick fluffy beige head. Nice candied citrus, floral leafy,citrus, grassy hoppy nose, with a pine, resin hop pellets, faint toasted, biscuity, caramel malt accent, and a subtle toffee, toasted bread crumb, lime, lemon peel note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a good herbal flowery resiny, piney, leafy, grassy hoppy character, with a mild toasted, caramelized, biscuity malty, zesty lemon, grapefruit peel, faint toffee, earthy tea leaf, subtle pineapple fruity flavours, leading towards a nice zesty, spritzy lemon, grapefruit peel, intense lingering resiny, piney, grassy, leafy hop bitterness finish.
Toasty, roasty, malty fun! A whole sleigh full of spruce too. Also, it got me lyrically tanked. Two things up.
Dark amber colour, off white pillowy head. Aroma - dank hops, sweaty, citrus, roasty. Taste - bitterness is quite high, earthy roasted malts and some citrus fruit flavours. Ok

Bottle. 7.0%. No best before date; bottled on 04.09.14. Pours a cloudy, deep amber with a tan head. Good lacing. Fat hop aroma, fruity and malty. Bread note as it warms. Heavy flavour; more fat hops, dark fruits and malt, with a light tart note. Rather bitter (pine) hop finish with a lingering alcohol burn and a hint of coffee (!). Overall pretty good; well-balanced with a good hop/bitterness profile: Certainly lives up to its name; not like the last beer I had which claimed to be all about the hops. 07.11.14.

Dark brown beer with a khaki coloured head. Ripe/dried fruits, caramel and sweet bread on the nose. Dry and not as sweet as I expected from the aroma. Lots of bitterness, not too harsh. Some earthy notes and bread flavor. Truly flooded with hops, no doubt about it. Quite good and enjoyable. Has a good bite.

bottle @ Vino Belissimo / Lima OH --- Hazy dark brown color, full ivory head that drops to a full cover, bands of lace. Taste is caramel malt with biscuit that grows as it moves through the palate, adding solid malt in the finish that asserts itself, then yields to allow malt to share the finish. A well-balanced, well-conceived, solid malt and hops brew. High recommendations.

11/4/14. 12oz bottle from Five Points. Hard to read, but I think it says BTLD 04/09/14. Murky brown pour with yeasty particulates suspended in the brew, under a nice one-finger khaki head that faces but laces pretty well. Burnt toffee in the aroma, a little musty, earthy, floral, mild nuttiness. Rich flavor, bitter, a bit of husky harshness, malty, caramel, nutty, floral, earthy. Not bad.

Amber looks with beige head and lots of lacing. Caramel, grapefruit and pines in the aroma. Taste has caramel, cookies? Grapefruit and pines bringing the bitterness, drying after taste. Medium body with medium carbonation. A little straightforward beer, but enjoyable still.

Pours dark amber with a small head.
Nose shows sweet caramel malt with a bit of a bready note. Some spicy and piny hops.
More rich malt as a flavour. Loads of pine and spicy hop again. Finishes with an aggressive, sharp bitterness.
Great moderately high carbonation.

Bottle. Deep copper with thick off-white head. Sweet ripe berries, bit of maltyness, sweet tea leafs, bit vinous notes. Somehow like dipa in a way actually. Nice though. Sweet berries with bit of bitter greens, blood grapefruit and hints of damp smokyness in taste. More of dipa sweetness towards the finish with lots of muted but quite nice hoppy notes coming through.

Bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours reddish brown with a little head. The aroma displays citrus fruitiness with some tropical notes; orange, zest and pine feature. Taste is initially sweetish, later drier. Hoppiness is strong and the bitterness medium to heavy in strength. The initial sweet maltiness makes the overall impression similar to double IPAs. Dry, very bitter, grapefruit-flavoured finish. The palate is medium to full bodied, the carbonation moderate and the texture oily. Overall a very potent amber ale that is closer to DIPAs than its style counterparts.
Dark, hazy, chunky brown pour. Small off white head. Little lacing. Piney aroma with some nutty malt notes. Bitter up front. Malty and piney. A bit of a bitter resin-like bite in the back.

On tap @ 10 East - 

Aroma - pine needles, grassy with some floral hops lurking around 

Appearance - clooudy amber body, 3-finger off-white head, good retention, average lacing 

Mouthfeel - medium bodied, medium carbonation 

Flavor - grapefruity bitterness, medium caramel malts with some cashew like flavors. Finish seems more lemony than anything. 

Overall - good hop profile through out the beer, no flaws picked out. Nothing extraordinary, but a good beer.

On tap at Hops and Pie poured a hazy reddish amber with a small lasting amber head. Aromas of caramel, grapefruit, pine and light earthiness. Palate was light bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of caramel, grapefruit and light pine with a smooth dry lingering bitter finish.

Pours dark amber into a snifter. Soapy head recedes leaving spider lacing. Stale caramel aromas. Thick and juicy with caramel and dark resin upfront turning to nutty toffee before the earthy bitter finish. Brewed 6 months ago....perhaps a little too much age on this one.
This is super hoppy in the first sip but is also incredibly dry. The Amber Malts just dont quite mix right with the dryness. Not what I hoped for.

Pours deep ruby red with off white foam head. Aroma is full on - grass, wood, blue cheese, feet, nut, vegetable. Flavour is mild chewy toffee sweetness, with bitter cabbage water finish. Dry wood earthy aftertaste. Lots of body and full of flavour. Nice.

"Talk about a blending of styles. I expected an iPa til I poured and a rather thick darker shade of brown ale came out. Hoppy, yes. Malty, yes. Tons of roast, pine, spruce, a hint of toffee and grapefruit. Very interesting beer. Hard to class. I put this in as a brown, because, well, its brown. BA has it as a brown. RB has it as an amber (shouldnt it be amber or red if its classed as an amber?) and others have it as an iPa. Idunno. Put it where you like, I say its a decent hoppy brown."

Bottle. Appearance: Dark red, thick off white head. Aroma: Roasty with quite a lot of pine/woody hops. Flavour: Tangy wood/pine hops again, resin, tons of malt, nice long bitter dank wood finish. Good.

Bottle @ home. Broke my avoid hoppy Danish beer rule since this was actually sort of cheap. Amber pour with an off-white head. Nose has some decent hop character to it. Mostly pine, but some light citrus and berry. Moderate caramel malts and toasty sweetness. Flavor is a bit on the sweet side, but enough citrus peel and pine to make it work. Somewhat floral. Kind of fruity on the finish.

Bottle 330ml @ Sommerhuset
Pours clear amber with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus, grape and pine. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long caramel, bitter and citrus fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle. Deep copper orange with a long lasting tan head. Lovely hoppy aroma, orange rind, caramel undertones. Sweet caramel and tropical fruit hops, long bitter finish. A nice hoppy amber, but I admire this brews lower ABV peers more for sheer drinkability (Im looking at you Stone Leviathon!)

Hops, roasted malt, grape in aroma. Taste has lots of hops, caramel, grape, pine and a long bitter aftertaste.
Poured from an oversize bottle. Lemon coloured head that quickly fades. Aroma is hops, citrus, pine, and sweet malts. Flavour follows the nose with notes of grapefruit. Solid IPA.

330 mL bottle from the Crowfoot Co-op liquor store in Calgary, served in a stem glass. Pours slightly hazy orange-caramel with a small beige head that remains and leaves a trace of lace. The nose has moderate citric, resinous hops paired with English style malts. The flavour is moderately bitter with resin and citrus. Bottle@ølhus københavn. Mahogany hazy. Really strong piny resinous nose with a bunch of dark, almost barley wine-y, raisin figsy caramels. Dark sweetness, quite bitter, leaving a pleasent bitter finish, with slightly chocolate caramel burps. Dark bready, foresty herbal. Flavourful, potent.-- bb

Bottle. Amber with a large beige head thats well retained. Aroma of kumquats, grapefruit, pine, bread crusts. Sweet bread crusts and caramel monstered by pine and citrus. Rather bitter at the end, where its a little peppery along with the lingering citrus. A bit like Bear Republic Red Rocket.
A great beer. Huge caramel and pine notes in the aroma and flavor. Lots of green and piney flavors backed by a sweet malty bill. Very nice.
Thanks Tony! Dark brownish amber with a fluffy head. Citrusy go aroma. Malt forward, brown sugar, citrus holds. Overall pretty nice.

Plusieurs particules en suspension, dont des résidus dhoublons, nagent allègrement dans une bière trouble aux teintes ambrées. Une mousse pas tout à fait blanche flotte au-dessus du verre assez longuement. Malgré lâge de la bouteille (6-7 mois), les houblons frais explosent au nez. En effet, les agrumes et le gazon fraîchement coupé pénètrent les narines sans crier gare. Ces houblons sactivent de nouveau en bouche, en y allant dune attaque citronnée intense. Les céréales légèrement caramélisées offrent un équilibre intéressant avec lamertume assez soutenue, spécialement en finale. Jaurais aimé la déguster pus fraîche, mais nempêche que cétait très agréable.
Bottle @ Haket Bar. Cloudy amber with a small off white head. malty and hoppy tones. Malt, fruit,, caramel and hops. Medium to full body with a nice bitter sweet after taste.

From 355 ml bottle in a tulip glass. Pour is dark, slightly hazy amber with a frothy pale head. Nose is strong bready malt with a hint of chocolate and dark fruits. Smells quite boozy. Pine bitterness punches in with the first sip. Strong bitterness almost like espresso aftertaste. Some grapefruit notes and malty sweetness are there too. Its amazing how this beer is still highly drinkable with such a dominating bitterness. It definitely deserves the name Hop Flood!

Pours a dark amber with some fine off white head. Nose is very fresh and juicy. I get some passionfruit, fresh orange, brown sugar, some biscuity crackeryness. Flavor is very bitter grapefruit, some caramel (regular and a hint of burnt caramel), a good whack of pine. The finish is of pine and grapefruit peel and very bitter. Medium bodied. Stupidly hoppy, with little accents that make it interesting.
Flowery aroma with a caramel color. Malty background with a hop ending. Hops lingers for a long time.
Mild aroma of hops pours a cloudy dark caramel color with a shot lasting well laced off-white head. Bitter hoppy taste with an oily feel and a bitter finish.

Poured from a bottle. Murky brown color, small white head. Floral hop aroma. Medium body with a floral body and a light finish.

Bottle at Kaisla, Helsinki. Dark brown colour. Nice citrussy hoppiness, some caramel, but quite bitter. Very good dark IPA.

Draft at Local Beer Eureka. Murky, muddy appearance with low persistent off-white froth. Sharp soapy top note yields to honey, white toast, and leafy components. Strong, dry, and bitter, reminiscent of Arrogant Bastard but greener. Retains a spot of yeast bite.

Draft at Roundhouse. Dark amber brown pour with fine head. Fresh hoppy aroma. Powerful bitter pine hop hit on first sip. Sweet malts to balance and lasting bitter finish. Very hoppy for amber ale. Would definitely get again.

(Bottle, 0.355 l - bottled 9.4.2014, at William K Kurvi, 20140821) The beer poured brown and clear. Its head was quite large, almost white and it lasted long. Aroma had fruitiness, caramel, malts and pine. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, caramel, fruitiness, sweetness and bitterness. Afteraste was hoppy, malty and bitter. Either the name was misleading or the hops had faded very quickly. Not bad but nothing special.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark amber with some sediment and an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are resin, pine, and grapefruit - with a bitter finish.

Bottled. Cloudy amber color, thick whipped cream head. Really fresh aroma ja citrusy and floral hop juices, pine creamy caramel and a touch of toasted nutty, slightly chocolatey malts. Really bitter, resinous bitterness dominates. Caramelly malts are well balanced. Some toasted grain notes add complexity. Delicious finish is a mixture of caramel and strongly resinous hop flavour. Medium body, smooth texture. Well done!

Bottle at Rotterdam, Helsinki. Dark red-brown color, good creamy beige head. Aroma has lots of resin and piney. Medium-bodied to full-bodied. Lots of resin, almost licorice saltyness because of heavy bitterness. Some alcohol. Simple maltyness. Good but heavy stuff. And of course this is not "amber ale" but ipa/dipa.

Bottle on 8/11/14. Pours a dark amber/brown with a fluffy just off white head. Nose is hoppy like an IPA (more than many), citrus, pine. Taste is sweet, some caramel, tropical fruit, followed by some strong grapefruit bitterness. Really yummy.

Part of an IPA tasting platter. Good beer, but expected much better. 7% is not that high, but this one definitely tasted boozy. Do they use some sugar to up the alcohol? I can understand that with 8% plus beer, but this did not need to be so. It took away from the very nice nose that set the expectations high. Again, this is a good beer, but could be much better.
Bottle. Toffee malt and hay aroma. Brown with small head. Lightly sweet caramel malt and moderate bitter herbal/grass flavor. Nice.
Bottle. Dark amber pour, with an off white head. Caramel, toffee, malty, sweetness, mild citrus, and finishes very sharp and bitter. High bitterness. Im not enjoying it too much.

Pours opaque brown with an ever so slightly off white head. Light lacing.
Aromas are a blend of piney hops and caramel malts.
Again the tastes are an almost perfect blend of pine and caramel.
Overall this is one of the most balanced beers I have drunk in quite some time. Maybe ever. Seriously.

Very nice beer whatever style it is. Poured with a large long-lasting cream-colored head, plenty of lace, and hazy to cloudy dark amber color. Aroma is quite mild with Hop toffee and malt. Flavor is like aroma but much stronger and more rich. Excellent body. Super drinking beer!

Nice hoppy amber that brings together rich bready toasty caramel malts with a grassy resinous hoppy character. A bit sweet for what it is but still quite tasty.

Brown pour with a 2 finger, fluffy tan head. Aroma is citrus, pine, herbal and spicy hops, caramel malt and burnt sugar. Flavor is citrus and spicy hops toast and dry nutty notes up front, followed by toasted pine, tannin bite, and grapefruit. Medium body, somewhat syrupy entry, light to medium carbonation and lots of tannin astringency to the finish. Pretty good, but a bit on the harsh, bark-like side.

text: Opaque ruddy brown pour, small off-white head. Aroma is caramel and earth, grass and citrus. Flavor is similar, earthy and grassy, and quite bitter. Not my thing, but a good beer.

Purchased a bottle at 7-11 Kittery, ME. Dirty amber color ( no I didnt dump all the bottle condition yeast into my snifter) with thin head retention. Aroma of dirty caramel malt, pine and a good dose of pine resin.  
The hop profile is earthy, piney and light grapefruit rind making the texture rather dry. The texture is gritty and chewy, and this is without the conditioning yeast from the bottle. Medium bitterness with lingering resin and pine hops. Pretty full body for the style, speaking of the style... It must be listed as a amber by request of the brewer because this is a IPA pine bomb if I ever tasted one. Ok, whatever works at this point. Solid brew.

Copper color, medium head, persistent lace. The aroma is caramel and apples, but it isnt strong. Theres not a lot in the nose from this one. The flavor is all malt up front, but the finish is well balanced. Sweet, rich malt behind a biting bitterness.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy medium brown with lots of floaties and a thin tan head. Aromas are bitter hops and caramel but the hops are fairly directionless. Flavor matches. Pointless and disappointing.

text: Bottle. Pours clear dark amber with a big lasting creamy white head that leaves excellent lacing. Weak aroma of citrus. Medium body, medium to heavy bitter taste, oily texture, lively carbonation and a very long bitter finish.

Bottle at home from Redmonds dark ruby with fluffy beige head collapsing to lacing. Rich pithy hops and toffee apples on the nose.moderate carbonation, very pithy almost campari like bitterness. Full bodied but perhaps not as fresh as it could be
Keg at Craft, Angel, 26th June 14. This is a nice beer, got a little heavy going though towards the end, ok
330ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique 250614. Deep amber almost brown colour. Hybrid amber ale IPA with big hop flavour.

From a bottle to a glass. Pour is an amber color. Dry, very hoppy flavor. Nice beer.

Flavor is very dry resin / pine hops, a tiny bit of sweetness, and almost no trace of an amber caramel that I was expecting. Such love for this beer. Its a mega US-style amber with loads of fantastic hop flavours and might be more correctly called an imperial IPA. The hops are so very, very smooth

12 oz bottle from Redmonds. Dark copper amber, huge frothy off white head. resiny, syrupy pine nose. Flavour follows the nose, sharp bitter hops. Light bodied, medium carbonation. Nice balance of bitter hops and sweet malt in the finish.
Had it @ craft beer Co Covent Garden. No honey. Very rich. Deep flavour. Good pour. Awesome

Not completely convinced on this one. Looks like an amber. And if try real hard, you can get some amber ale flavor as well. But otherwise, this is more of a resin-forward hop bomb, bitter like a stronger IPA. If it had less resin-ness and a bit less syrupy mouthfeel, I would like it more.

East of Everything ontap (7-Jun-2014) Light herbal swetish biscuit toffee malt aroma.Black brown, decent head and sheet fluffy lace.Sweet malt herbal spice, light plum flavour.Bitter herbal spice sweet light plum finish and herbal spice aftertaste.

Keg @ Drygate. Dark brown, not much head. Resin aroma. Strong sweet hop & malt flavour. Bitter sweet caramel malt aftertaste. A strong American style bitter.

From bottle. A deep red-amber with a thin off-white head. The aroma is grapefruit, caramel, resin, pine. A dense flavour profile of grapefruit, caramel malt, pine, medium sweetness. A dry and very bitter finish. Brings some class to the style.

2 oz. or smaller pour, from a 12 oz. bottle at St. Paul Summer Beer Fest. Consumed on 6-7-14. Pours a hazy brown/amber with taupe/beige head. Honey sweet aroma features scents of resin and pine. Bottle from CBX. Very deep amber pour with a bubbly off white head. Resiny, dank hoppiness with notes of pine with a balanced caramel malt back bone in the nose. Amber in color, clear with a thin head. Nice easy drinking Amber ale. Big alcohol flavor this was flavorful. Interesting and easy beer.

Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi aggressive hop bitterness in the close.
Solid hoppy amber.

Pours a cloudy dark amber brew with a big reddish head with regular to goodretention, aroma is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate bitter with caramel, cchocolate and floral hops, medium bodied, moderate carbonatation, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a bitter finish, a good red ipa

I swear theres some rye in there based on the spiciness. A very good beer, definitely a sipper due to the intensity of the pine hops.

On tap at Mother Kellys London. Clear mahogany colour lasting dark beige head. Amber malts give balance and a little sweetness to the big hops. Ive always liked this American Amber style of beer. [Bottle (12oz)] Pours a dark amber with an average size lasting frothy beige head. Some lacing. Nice catty, hempy aroma, resiny, citrusy and spicy as well, along with bready malt, light alcohol, some fruit, grain and light vegetal notes. Medium-plus body. Smooth, kind of crisp lighter carbonation. Lightly dry finish. Some caramel malt aroma, some toasty malt, and spicy hop malt flavor, lightly earthy hop. Indeed, hops show more in bitterness than aroma. Interesting, assertive stuff, though.

Sampled at the W&C Beer Fest 2014. It poured a hazy brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of roasted malts, some fruits and hops. The taste was of caramel, chocolate, roast and again some hops. Nice.

Tasted from draft. Pours a cloud ruby brown with off white head. Aroma of citrus,figs, pine, caramel. Taste is moderate to heavily bitter with citrus and pine notes. Just a hint of malt sweetness. Medium bodied. Definitely more bitter than most ambers. Pretty dang good.
